title: Why did TIME magazine replace its logo with ‘VOTE’ for the first time in its 100-year history? - Quora
tags: Time Magazine's Person of the Year

response.answer_text: In explaining its decision to replace its logo with the word “Vote” in its most recent issue, Time magazine Editor-in-Chief Edward Felsenthal, in part, wrote this: “Few events will shape the world to come more than the result of the upcoming U.S. presidential election…“On Nov. 3 (or, hopefully, soon after), we will finally get an answer to the question of what these past four discombobulating years have meant,” writes TIME’s national political correspondent Molly Ball. “It is a decision not about what policy proposals to pursue but about what reality we collectively decide to inhabit.” [1] In other words, with this election, probably more than any other presidential election in our nation’s history, we have an opportunity to make a fundamental change in the tone and direction our country has taken in the last four years. Footnotes[1] TIME Replaced Its Logo on the Cover For the First Time in Its Nearly 100-Year History

After decades of our mass media essentially crying wolf by telling us that every election is an existential crisis, for once this one actually is. We lead the world in confirmed pandemic deaths. This president is trying to defund social security, and remove the pre-existing conditions clause of Obamacare, he has actively worked to kick people off of disability in the middle of a global pandemic. His decisions are literally killing people. The stakes have never been higher.  Trump’s Plan To Defund Social Security - Center for American Progress The next move in Trump administration's war on the disabled Trump's budget could make it harder to stay on Social Security disability insurance President’s Budget Would Hurt People With Disabilities

I would assume it is because the US is at a pivotal tipping point were it can either decend into a religious and racist autocracy or start the return to a democracy where people can vote fairly and be treated with respect. Just my opinion as an outsider looking in.
